meanings.definition: Something that is carried over from one time period to another.
meanings.sent1: The carryover of snacks from yesterday's lunch made today's snack time extra special.
meanings.sent2: The carryover of traditions from generation to generation keeps our family bond strong.
meanings.sent3: The carryover of jokes from the party had everyone laughing for days.
meanings.sent4: The carryover of knowledge from school to work helped me excel in my new job.
meanings.sent5: The carryover of skills from one project to the next made me a valuable team member.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring or continuing something from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The carryover of boxes from the old house to the new one was exhausting.
meanings.sent2: The carryover of responsibilities from one team member to another ensured a smooth transition.
meanings.sent3: The carryover of chores from Monday to Tuesday left me with a never-ending to-do list.
meanings.sent4: The carryover of music from the living room to the kitchen kept the party vibe going.
meanings.sent5: The carryover of ideas from the brainstorming session to the meeting impressed our boss.

meanings.definition: An amount of something that remains after a process is completed.
meanings.sent1: The carryover of paint after finishing the walls was used for touch-ups.
meanings.sent2: The carryover of funds in the budget allowed for unexpected expenses to be covered.
meanings.sent3: The carryover of ingredients after baking the cake inspired me to make cupcakes too.
meanings.sent4: The carryover of energy after the workout motivated me to go for a run.
meanings.sent5: The carryover of time after finishing the project gave me a head start on the next task.
